Package main.java

Class Piece

java.lang.Object
main.java.Piece
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class Piece extends Object
Abstract class representing a chess piece. Provides the framework for all specific types of chess pieces. Includes common properties, i.e. color, position, and provides abstract methods to be overridden in subclasses.

      public Piece(Piece.Player color, Position position)
      Constructor.
      Parameters:
      color - The color of the piece. (Must be WHITE or BLACK.)
      position - The initial position of the piece on the board.

      Gets the position of the piece.

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition(Position position)
      Sets the position of the piece.
      Parameters:
      position - The updated position of the piece.

    • getPotentialMoves

      public abstract List<Position> getPotentialMoves()
      Abstract method to generate all potential moves for the piece. Subclasses take game state into account.
      Returns:
      A list of potential moves.

    • isValidMove

      public abstract boolean isValidMove(Board board, Tile startTile, Tile endTile)
      Abstract method to determine if a move is valid based on the current game state.
      Parameters:
      board - The current game board state.
      startTile - The starting tile of the piece moving.
      endTile - The ending tile of the piece moving.
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid.

    • isOccupiedBySameColor

      protected boolean isOccupiedBySameColor(Tile endTile)
      Method to determine if the end tile is occupied by a piece of the same color. Using this disallows the option for piece capture.
      Parameters:
      endTile - The tile to be checked.
      Returns:
      true if the end tile is occupied by a piece of the same color.

    • getImage

      public javafx.scene.image.Image getImage()
      Gets the image representation of the piece. The image is determined based on the piece's color and type.
      Returns:
      The image of the piece.

    • getPlayer

      public Piece.Player getPlayer()
      Gets the player color of the piece.
      Returns:
      The player color.
